page.title: 16Transport in Whittlesey
page.content: The town is cut in half by a main road the A605. This road has recently been widened and straightened. It is the main link between Whittlesey and Peterborough. Many people work in the city and live in Whittlesey resulting in some congestion in the morning and late afternoon. During the winter many minor accidents occur due to ice and fog caused by the nearness of the road to a river. A local bus company runs a 20 minute service to Peterborough, the journey takes about 35 minutes. Other less frequent services run to other nearby towns and villages. A rail service runs to Peterborough and March 4 times daily. Most families own or have use of a car. Nearly all the people who live in Whittlesey have and use a bicycle for going to work or shopping.
